title: Largest Arable Land Area
description: In 2021, the United States had 157,736,800 hectares of arable land, making it one of the largest in the world.

title: Leading Provider of Development Aid
description: In 2022, the United States provided $60.3 billion in total net Official Development Assistance (ODA), with $11.7 billion directed to the least developed countries.

title: High Taxation on Income and Profits
description: In 2023, taxes on income, profits, and capital gains constituted 92.91% of total taxes in the United States.

title: Extensive Rail Network
description: The United States had a total rail line route of 148,553 kilometers in 2021, one of the most extensive networks globally.

title: Most Secure Internet Servers
description: In 2023, the United States had 62,879,335 secure internet servers, leading the world in digital security infrastructure.

title: Highest Education Expenditure
description: In 2021, the United States spent $1.05 trillion on education, reflecting its commitment to educational development.

title: Significant Energy Depletion Costs
description: In 2021, the United States faced $178.2 billion in energy depletion costs, highlighting its energy consumption challenges.

title: High Product Taxation
description: In 2021, taxes less subsidies on products amounted to $829.2 billion, indicating a high level of product taxation.

title: Top Health Expenditure Per Capita
description: In 2022, the United States spent $12,434 per capita on health, the highest globally, reflecting its focus on healthcare.

title: Lowest Prevalence of Wasting in Children
description: In 2022, the United States reported a prevalence of wasting among children under 5 at just 0.1%, one of the lowest rates globally.

title: Minimal Prevalence of Anemia in Children
description: As of 2019, only 6.1% of children aged 6-59 months in the United States were affected by anemia, showcasing a strong public health outcome.

title: Significant Current Account Deficit
description: In 2023, the United States had a current account deficit of $905.4 billion, indicating a substantial imbalance in international trade and financial flows.

title: High Net Financial Account Deficit
description: The net financial account for the United States in 2023 was negative $924.1 billion, reflecting significant outflows of financial resources.

title: Large Net Trade Deficit in Goods
description: In 2023, the United States recorded a net trade deficit in goods of $1.06 trillion, highlighting a major trade imbalance.

title: Minimal Prevalence of Anemia in Pregnant Women
description: The prevalence of anemia among pregnant women in the United States was 11.5% in 2019, one of the lowest globally.

title: Low Prevalence of Wasting in Female Children
description: In 2016, only 0.1% of female children under 5 in the United States were affected by wasting, indicating excellent nutritional standards.

title: Low Prevalence of Wasting in Male Children
description: As of 2018, the prevalence of wasting among male children under 5 in the United States was just 0.2%, reflecting strong health outcomes.

title: Substantial Portfolio Investment Outflows
description: The United States experienced a net portfolio investment outflow of $1.15 trillion in 2023, indicating significant capital movement abroad.

title: Negative Net Secondary Income
description: In 2023, the United States had a net secondary income deficit of $187.5 billion, reflecting more transfers abroad than received.
